DataElement.preferredName: Autoimmune Or Immunodeficiency Disease or Disorder Personal Medical History Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether a patient has a personal medical history of autoimmune disease or immunodeficiency disease/disorder.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Autoimmune Or Immunodeficiency Disease or Disorder Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to a history of condition(s) in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them or a disorder in which the immune system is unable to mount an adequate immune response.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Autoimmune Disease Or Immunodeficiency Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A disorder in which the immune system is unable to mount an adequate immune response.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A disorder in which the immune system is unable to mount an adequate immune response.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have active auto
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease or history of autoimmune disease that might recur, which may affect vital organ function or require immune suppressive treatment including systemic corticosteroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or primary immunodeficiency?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or risk of autoimmune disease, including, but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegeners granulomatosis, Sjogrens syndrome, Bells palsy, Guillain-Barre syndrome, multiple sclerosis, autoimmune thyroid disease, vasculitis, lichen sclerosis, or glomerulonephritis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of symptomatic disease (e.g., rheumatoid arthritis, systemic progressive sclerosis [scleroderma], systemic lupus erythematosus, autoimmune vasculitis [e.g., Wegener's Granulomatosis]); CNS or motor neuropathy considered of autoimmune origin (e.g., Guillain-Barre Syndrome and Myasthenia Gravis, multiple sclerosis)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or risk of autoimmune disease, including, but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegener's granulomatosis, Sjögren's syndrome, Bell's palsy, Guillain-Barré syndrome, multiple sclerosis, autoimmune thyroid disease, vasculitis, or glomerulonephritis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have autoimmune diseases, including but not limited to patients with a history of immune related neurologic disease, multiple sclerosis, autoimmune (demyelinating) neuropathy, Guillain-Barre syndrome, myasthenia gravis; systemic autoimmune disease such as SLE, connective tissue diseases, scleroderma, autoimmune vasculitis, inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), Crohn's, ulcerative colitis, hepatitis; and patients with a history of toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN), Stevens-Johnson syndrome, or phospholipid syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease, a history of known or suspected autoimmune disease or a history of a syndrome requiring systemic corticosteroids (greater than10 mg daily of prednisone equivalent) except for the treatment of malignancy with the exception of: Isolated vitiligo; resolved childhood atopy; history of a positive ANA titer without associated symptoms or history of symptoms of an autoimmune disorder; Controlled thyroid disorders; Type I diabetes mellitus; Psoriasis, Sjögren's syndrome, and arthropathies not requiring systemic treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or risk of autoimmune disease that threatens vital organ function, including, but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, inflammatory bowel disease, vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegener's granulomatosis, Guillain-Barre syndrome, multiple sclerosis, or glomerulonephritis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of active or severe autoimmune disease: Inflammatory bowel disease, including ulcerative colitis and Crohn's Disease, rheumatoid arthritis, systemic progressive scleroderma, systemic lupus erythematosis, autoimmune vasculitis (e.g., Wegener's Granulomatosis), CNS or motor neuropathy considered of autoimmune origin (e.g. Guillain-Barre Syndrome, myasthenia gravis, multiple sclerosis)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of active primary immunodeficiency?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or risk of autoimmune disease, including but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegener's granulmatosis, Sjogren's syndrome, Bell's palsy, Guillain-Barre' syndrome', multiple slerosis, autoimmune thyroid disease, vasculitis or glomerulonephritis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of a well-characterized and defined immune deficiency prior to the diagnosis of MF/SS or is receiving systemic steroid therapy greater than 10mg/day of Prednisone or equivalent within 4 weeks or any other form of immunosuppressive therapy within 7 days prior to the first dose of trial treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or risk of autoimmune disease, including, but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegener's granulomatosis, Sjögren's syndrome, Bell's palsy, Guillain-Barré syndrome, multiple sclerosis, autoimmune thyroid disease, vasculitis, lichen sclerosis, or glomerulonephritis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or risk of autoimmune disease, including, but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, autoimmune hemolytic anemia, Wegener's granulomatosis, Sjögren's syndrome, Bell's palsy, Guillain-Barré syndrome, multiple sclerosis, autoimmune thyroid disease, vasculitis, or glomerulonephritis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of, or current autoimmune disease, including, but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegener's granulomatosis, Sjögren's syndrome, Bell's palsy, Guillain-Barré syndrome, multiple sclerosis, autoimmune thyroid disease, vasculitis, or glomerulonephritis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of or current autoimmune disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment within the past 3 months, a documented history of clinically severe autoimmune disease, or a syndrome that requires systemic steroids or immunosuppressive agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease or history of autoimmune disease that might recur, which may affect vital organ function and study PI has not been consulted?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history of, or current autoimmune disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active systemic lupus, scleroderma, or dermatomyositis with a CPK level above normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease or history of autoimmune disease that might recur, which may affect vital organ function or require immune suppressive treatment including high dose systemic corticosteroids including but not limited to: immune-related neurologic disease, such as multiple sclerosis, autoimmune (demyelinating) neuropathy, Guillain-Barre syndrome, or myasthenia gravis; systemic autoimmune disease such as Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE), connective tissue diseases, scleroderma, inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), Crohn's, ulcerative colitis, or autoimmune hepatitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a primary immunodeficiency or history of systemic autoimmune disease (e.g., Crohn's, rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus) requiring systemic immunosuppression/systemic disease modifying agents within the last 2 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease or history of autoimmune disease that might recur, which may affect vital organ function or require immune suppressive treatment including systemic corticosteroids including but not limited to patients with a history of immune related neurologic disease, multiple sclerosis, autoimmune (demyelinating)  neuropathy, Guillain-Barre syndrome, myasthenia gravis; systemic autoimmune disease such as SLE, connective tissue diseases, scleroderma, inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), Crohn's, ulcerative colitis, hepatitis; and patients with a history of toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN), Stevens-Johnson syndrome, or phospholipid syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of Guillain-Barré syndrome or myasthenia gravis at any point?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has SJOGREN'S SYNDROME (SJS) diagnosed by a rheumatologist or oral medicine provider according to the American-European Consensus Criteria for Sjögren's Syndrome (Vitali, et al., 2002), do they meet the inclusion/exclusion criteria in Appendix J?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known primary immunodeficiency?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or risk of autoimmune disease, including, but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, autoimmune hemolytic anemia, Wegener's granulomatosis, Sjogren's syndrome, Bell's palsy, Guillain-Barre syndrome, multiple sclerosis, vasculitis, or glomerulonephritis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have primary immunodeficiency or history of systemic autoimmune disease (e.g., Crohns, rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus) requiring systemic immunosuppression/systemic disease modifying agents within the indicated time point?

DataElement.changeDescription: 9672_Theradex_03.23.15_ghd 03-20-2018 Fixed Theradex CRF Text 12, 13, 14, 4, 9 to replace upside question mark with apostrophe DW
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.2 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002682. ak 8/5/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT_wz 2022.8.10 Corrected special character Ticket CADSR0001350. ak
